CIPHER.0.cipherString:
THE SCIENTIFIC THEORY I LIKE BEST IS THAT THE RINGS
OF SATURN ARE COMPOSED ENTIRELY OF LOST AIRLINE
LUGGAGE
CIPHER.0.question: Solve this Aristocrat which is a quote by Mark Russell.

CIPHER.1.cipherString: DO NOT FEAR TO BE ECCENTRIC IN OPINION, FOR EVERY OPINION NOW ACCEPTED WAS ONCE ECCENTRIC.
CIPHER.1.question: Solve this quote from Bertrand Russell which has been encoded with the Atbash Cipher. {Rule e.i}

CIPHER.2.cipherString: SOMETIMES I THINK WE'RE ALONE IN THE UNIVERSE, AND SOMETIMES I THINK WE'RE NOT. IN EITHER CASE THE IDEA IS QUITE STAGGERING.
CIPHER.2.question: A quote from Arthur C. Clarke has been encoded using a Caesar Cipher. What does it say? {Rule e.ii}

CIPHER.3.cipherString:
IS THERE ANY KNOWLEDGE IN THE WORLD WHICH IS SO
CERTAIN THAT NO REASONABLE MAN COULD DOUBT IT?
CIPHER.3.question: Solve this Aristocrat which is a quote by Bertrand Russell which has the word MAN in it. {rule e.iii (1)}

CIPHER.4.cipherString:
MARS IS THE ONLY PLACE IN THE SOLAR SYSTEM WHERE IT'S
POSSIBLE FOR LIFE TO BECOME MULTI-PLANETARIAN
CIPHER.4.question: Solve this Aristocrat which is a quote by Elon Musk.  {rule e.iii (2)}

CIPHER.5.cipherString:
THE GOVERNMENT WILL SEA THAT YOU MEN SPACEFLIGHT IS
USEFUL - FORCE I HENCE AND THE ECONOMY - AND
INSPIRATIONAL.
CIPHER.5.question: Alexa severely misheard a phrase from Helen Sharman which has the word THE twice and then encoded it as an Aristocrat.  What did it come out as? {rule e.iii (3)}

CIPHER.6.cipherString:
ALL WAYS BARE INN MINED THAT YOU'RE OWN RESOLUTION
TWO SUCCEED, IS MORE IMPORTANT THAN ANY OTHRE WON
THING.
CIPHER.6.question: Someone really mangled this phrase from Abraham Lincoln encoding it as an Aristocrat.  What did it come out as? {rule e.iii (4)}

CIPHER.7.cipherString: I WOULD LIKE TO SPEAK IN TERMS OF PRAISE DUE TO THE MANY BRAVE OFFICERS AND SOLDIERS WHO HAVE FOUGHT IN THE CAUSE OF THE WAR
CIPHER.7.question: Solve this K1 encoded Patristocrat which is a quote by Abraham Lincoln and starts with the words I WOULD {rule e.iii(5)}

CIPHER.8.cipherString: AND BELIEVE ME IF I WERE AGAIN BEGINNING MY STUDIES I SHOULD FOLLOW THE ADVICE OF PLATO AND START WITH MATHEMATICS
CIPHER.8.question: Solve this Patristocrat of a quote by Galileo Galilei, encoded using a K2 key. {rule e.iii (6)}

CIPHER.9.question: Encode the Kurt Vonnegut’s quote: SCIENCE IS MAGIC THAT WORKS using the Affine Cipher with a=7 and b=17. {Rule e.iv}

CIPHER.10.cipherString: when the going gets tough, put one foot in front of the other and just keep going.  Don't give up.
CIPHER.10.question: A phrase by Roy T. Bennett has been encoded using the Vigenère cipher with a code work of STEPS.  What does it say? {Rule e.v}

CIPHER.11.cipherString: DEBEMOS LLAMAR CIENCIA SOLO AL CONJUNTO DE LAS FORMULAS QUE TRIUNFAN SIEMPRE. TODO EL RESTO ES LITERATURA.
CIPHER.11.question: Solve this K1 encoded Xenocrypt which is a translation of a quote by Paul Valéry into Spanish. {Rules e.vii and f.vi}

CIPHER.12.question: Using a key of TEST compute the decryption matrix for a 2x2 Hill with a 26 character alphabet.  e.g. {Rule e.viii}

CIPHER.13.keyword: WE THE PEOPLE OF THE UNITED STATES, IN ORDER TO FORM A MORE PERFECT UNION, ESTABLISH JUSTICE, INSURE DOMESTIC TRANQUILITY, PROVIDE FOR THE COMMON DEFENSE, PROMOTE THE GENERAL WELFARE, AND SECURE THE BLESSINGS OF LIBERTY TO OURSELVES AND OUR POSTERITY, DO ORDAIN AND ESTABLISH THIS CONSTITUTION FOR THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.
CIPHER.13.cipherString: WHAT YOU DO MAKES A DIFFERENCE, AND YOU HAVE TO DECIDE WHAT KIND OF DIFFERENCE YOU WANT TO MAKE.
CIPHER.13.question: The following quote from Jane Goodall has been encoded using a running key cipher against a famous document.  What does it say? {Rule f.ii}

CIPHER.14.cipherString: THERE ARE THOSE WHO REASON WELL BUT THEY ARE GREATLY OUT NUMBERED BY THOSE WHO REASON BADLY
CIPHER.14.question: Galileo Galilei once said this about thinking.  It has been encoded using the Vigenère cipher using a very common five letter word.  You have been told that the 17th through the 22nd letters in the code (YMNCHU) actually is the word REASON.  What does the message decode to? {Rule f.iii}

CIPHER.15.question: Using a key of LOST decode the string QNFWNQNAFCCT using the Hill Cipher with a 26 character alphabet. {Rule f.v}

CIPHER.16.question: A message from Walt Whitman encrypted with the Affine Cipher using an alphabet of 26 characters has been received.  You have been told that the first two letters are WE.  With that knowledge, what does this message say? {Rule F.vii}

CIPHER.17.question:
Anne has faithfully followed the steps of the RSA key-generation algorithm, but has forgotten the last step—how to encrypt a message. First, here are her results from the other steps: {Rule f.iv}

       p = 3457
       q = 2347
       n = 8113579
       Φ = 8107776 
       e = 7654337
       d = 7706177

As it comes to pass, her boss Marge is on vacation in Hawaii, and Anne needs a document that is stored in the company safe. They are communicating via email, and both know it is very unwise to trust the security of computers in a hotel lobby.  Anne needs to tell Marge her public key, knowing full well that it can be read by untrustworthy parties. List the minimum set of numbers that Anne needs to email to Marge in order for Marge to be able to decode the message.

Additionally, Marge wants to transmit the combination to the safe (which is 290812) in the response email, but encrypted with RSA. What should formula will Marge need compute in order to know the ciphertext to transmit?

CIPHER.18.question: Vernon and Marge are accountants for a very large bank, and have started a friendship. They communicate via email, because they live thousands of miles apart. Marge gets curious and asks Vernon the year that they were born. Vernon doesn’t mind telling Marge, but they know that the bank monitors all employee emails, and is afraid of being the victim of age discrimination. Therefore, Marge suggests that they use RSA, and provides their public key: (57, 2173). Vernon uses that and replies with the ciphertext 409. Marge’s private key is 73. In what year was Vernon born? {Rule f.iv}

CIPHER.19.question: Using a key of CARNIVALS encode the string ASTROBIOLOGIST using the Hill Cipher with a 26-character alphabet. {Rule f.v}

CIPHER.20.cipherString: You can't teach anybody anything, only make them realize the answers are already inside them
CIPHER.20.question: The following symbols encodes a phrase by Galileo Galilei using a Baconian alphabet.  What does it say? {Rule e.vi}
